answers.answer: To start you need to be tested for ft3 and ft4. It would appear you need to be given a t3 med not just t4 me.This is possibly just the starting point. Can you see a rheumatologist? They need, to test you for other autoimmune conditions as there may be multiple things going on.   Please also get tested for diabetes: hba1c (3 month blood sugar) and fasting glucose.Is your dr an endocrinologist? If not,  you may also need to see one. Full hormone and endocrine workup too, if possible.  Check adrenals.

question: Hello, yes it's me again with my latest blood test results.  These are the results that were taken on April 1st, with taking 75mg of Levo:-TSH 1,17 (0.27 - 4.20)T3 4,2 (3.1 - 6.8)T4 13,9 (12 - 22)Moving forward to these are my latest (taken on Monday) with upping my dosage to 100mg of Levo. Lab parameters are the same:-TSH 0,86T3 3,5T4 16,7This time the same DR actually listened to me, as I explained the situation regarding the possibility of the UK opting out of the EU, hence I would be in big trouble.  All vitamins came back with really good ranges, as I'm now taking supplements, but I have never been so tired in all my life.  he also tested for these:-VGM 100,9 (77,1 - 94.5)TCHM 35,1 (25.4 - 32.4)I have also developed a brown rash on the cheeks of my face, and also my nose - most odd.  Why has my T3 dropped like this? is it the fact that I'm not converting?  he also tested me for this:-Polynuclear eos :-0,,072 (0,083 - 0..566)Please, any advice on these results would be so very most welcome, as for example yesterday, I was asleep for 18hours, my legs are aching, my feet are tingling, and the weight is dropping off me like you wouldn't believe, and I'm not even trying, as I don't need to lose anything.  I'm nearly 6ft tall, and I'm weighing in at 120lb.
title: Please, I need advice.
